presentation.fsa
Class ArrowHead

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Polygon
      presentation.fsa.ArrowHead
All Implemented Interfaces:
Shape, Serializable
public class ArrowHead
extends Polygon

A filled polygon in the shape of an arrowhead.

Author:
Helen Bretzke

Constructor Detail

ArrowHead

public ArrowHead()
Construct a default arrowhead at location (0,0) and orientation in direction (0,1) ie. pointing down.

ArrowHead

public ArrowHead(Point2D.Float dir,
                 Point2D.Float base)
Construct an ArrowHead shape oriented in direction dir with nock located at base.

Parameters:
dir - A unit direction from nock to tip.
base - the coordinates of the nock

public ArrowHead(Point2D dir,
                 Point2D base)
Construct an ArrowHead shape oriented in direction dir with nock located at base.

Parameters:
dir - A unit direction from nock to tip.
base - the coordinates of the nock
Method Detail

setLocationAndDirection

public void setLocationAndDirection(Point2D.Float base,
                                    Point2D.Float dir)
Set my location to base and rotate all of my points to orient with direction vector dir. NOTE this method is not used when drawing the arrowhead on edges since problems occurred with flicker. When drawing arrowhead on canvas use AffineTransform on the Graphics context. FIXME Since the default orientation is stored in memory but the arrowhead is only rotated when rendered, checking for intersections will not work properly.

Parameters:
base - base point of the arrow head
dir - unit direction vector

reset

public void reset()
Sets arrowhead to default location (0,0) and orientation in direction (0,1) ie. pointing down.

Overrides:
reset in class Polygon

getBasePt

protected Point2D.Float getBasePt()
Returns the base point or location of nock of this arrowhead.

Returns:
the base point
